item.title: With dueling rallies this week, Georgia is on the mind for Trump and Harris
item.description: Vice President Harris and former President Donald Trump are both in Georgia this week, competing for votes in a crucial swing state where polls show a razor thin margin separating the two candidates.

item.title: Israeli Settlers Want to Permanently Occupy Gaza
item.description:
Even as the war in Gaza is still on-going, there are calls from inside Israel's right-wing government for a permanent occupation of the Palestinian territory and to allow Jewish settlements there. While the Prime Minister says this is not the government's policy, some say the military's latest moves make it possible. Our correspondent tells us more from the Israel-Gaza border.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

item.title: When Steamboat goes WHOOSH, scientists look for answers

item.title: Turkey hits Kurdish militant targets after a deadly attack on defense company
item.description: Turkey’s air force struck Kurdish militant targets in Iraq and Syria in apparent retaliation for an attack at a state-run defense company that killed five people and wounded more than a dozen others.
